result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L Lavelle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Firearms can be returned to Defendant.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
Restitution is to be determined within 30 days.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L Lavelle

records.addlTxt: from Defendant's sister-in-law in support of Defendant

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Sandra Jean Wagner. Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in custody. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant. State makes statement regarding victim rights. Discussion regarding restitution, court-ordered financial obligations. Court reviews letters from Defendant's wife, sister-in-law. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
from Defense requesting to be included in scheduling of sentencing after rev hearing
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 14, 2017 at 09:00 am.
from Defense enclosing letter from Defendant's wife

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for DNA sample

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 3.   State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for plea/sentencing. Court reviews previous activity, letter from Defense requesting rescheduling. State does not object. Defense makes statement, requests Court date in January, requests amended bond. State requests bond continue as is, that restitution be paid to his office.  Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2017 at 11:00 am.
by Defendant to Adjourn Plea and Sentencing Hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to Adjourn Status Conference by Defendant

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests plea/sentencing date. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
by Defendant to adjourn status conference
from Atty Petrouske re: rescheduling
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense requests status in 60 days, advises of offer that involves payment of restitution. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
by State

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial. Bond continues as is.  Arraignment scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court with attorney Randall Walter Petrouske. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
by Defendant
for discovery

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant has talked to 2 attorneys, has meeting scheduled for tomorrow afternoon, requests additional time to arrange for Counsel. Bond continues as is.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
by Tracey A. Lavelle

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess firearms or ammunition. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.
Door County Jail

Defendant Patrick L Lavelle appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/9/15, 10:00.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 11/1/15.
